channel.title: New Polymer £5 Notes Printing
channel.description:
www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/polymer/Pages/default.aspx
Moving to Polymer Banknotes The next Bank of England £5, £10 and £20 banknotes will be printed on polymer.
The new fiver will be issued in September 2016. On 2 June, the full details of the design and security features were revealed and a range of training materials for retailers and businesses have been made available. You can find out more about the new polymer £5 note at www.thenewfiver.co.uk
The £10 note will be issued in 2017 and the £20 note by 2020.
Polymer banknotes are cleaner, more secure, and more durable than paper banknotes. They will provide enhanced counterfeit resilience, and increase the quality of banknotes in circulation.

item.title: New Polymer £5 Notes Printing
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Meanwhile America is bitching about putting Harriet Tubman on the $20 (is that still happening? I forget).

Yes I did a lot of digging to try to find the “bill schedule” that Congress passed a few years ago for this. Most people don’t realize this has been in the works to change the bills in general.

Read full topic

item.title: New Polymer £5 Notes Printing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RuneAgent, post:14, topic:555568”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=674777.msg4509511#msg4509511 date=1465495109]

enjoy your monopoly money we will be using Crane & Co paper until the end of time for our currency.

Approx. 5 years at most if trump is president.
If Hillary wins, expect women on the US money.
[/quote]
we already are getting a woman on the $20 jackson is being put on the rear and I think tubman is getting put on the front.[/quote]
Yeah I brought that up earlier in the post. I wasn’t sure if they were going through with it or not.

Read full topic

item.title: New Polymer £5 Notes Printing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Also beware of using them to snort drugs. They cut the inside of your nose.

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:555568”][quote author=jme link=topic=674777.msg4509442#msg4509442 date=1465306903]
We’ve had these for quite a few years in Canada. When they first came out they seemed to have issues with sticking to each other. I heard many stories of people getting extra bills at ATM machines. At the time I was a cashier and also had to double count everything.
[/quote]
Is it true if you scratch the maple leaf on the money it smells like maple syrup? I heard that somewhere.[/quote]

No, but if you scratch the queen it smells like farts

Read full topic
